ThAdmiral wrote:You are a
vanilla townie
,
Town
aligned, and you've got no special powers at Night. No investigations, no protection, no gun to shoot people. Your only powers are the ability to post, vote, and think.

You win when all the scum are eliminated (even if you are dead by that time), so try to lynch well!

This game will be held in Little Italy, and here is a link to the game.

Rules1. This is a game. Have fun. Don't let things get personal.

2. During Day, you may vote for the player you want to lynch. Votes should be in the form
Vote: Player
or they may not be counted. It is helpful to "
Unvote
" when switching your vote to a different player, though this is not required.

3. Whenever a player has a majority in votes, that player will be lynched, his or her role will be revealed, and Night will begin. Once a player has reached a majority, Twilight will begin. No votes or unvotes will be registered, although talking may continue until the thread is locked. You may also
Vote: No Lynch
; a majority will end Day without a death.

4. If discussion lags or Day goes on for too long, a deadline may be set. If no one has reached a majority at the deadline, the person with the most votes will be lynched.

5. During Night, players with role abilities may send targets for those abilities. Choices are due by the posted deadline, but day may start earlier if the choices are sent in early.

6. Don't edit/delete posts. Use the "Preview" button to look over your post before you submit it.

7. Don't quote any PMs from the Moderator.

8.
Mafia, werewolves, masons etc. are allowed to communicate by PM/QT at all times
(i.e. not just during the night phase). Otherwise, do not talk to anyone about this game outside the thread.

9. When you are killed you may make one final post (as long as it is simply an "oh well" type post that doesn't reveal any game information), but then you are dead. Do not talk until the game is over; this includes talking to living players outside the thread.

10. I will send out prods at my discretion/on request. Players may be replaced if a prod is not responded to.

11. No attempting to break the game with cryptography or invisible text etc.

12. If you have any question, complaint, or comment, PM the Moderator.

13. I reserve the right to add or modify a rule as I see fit
Please confirm in thread
/confirm (and conform)

Now I have a question about signatures while we are off-topic here... See my Sig? Why does it do that?

nintendoaddict1 wrote:Now I have a question about signatures while we are off-topic here... See my Sig? Why does it do that?
Forums like Mafiascum don't use HTML on the surface, they use BBCode.
BBCode Guide Introduction wrote:
What is BBCode?

BBCode is a special implementation of HTML. Whether you can actually use BBCode in your posts on the forum is determined by the administrator. In addition you can disable BBCode on a per post basis via the posting form. BBCode itself is similar in style to HTML, tags are enclosed in square brackets [ and ] rather than < and > and it offers greater control over what and how something is displayed. Depending on the template you are using you may find adding BBCode to your posts is made much easier through a clickable interface above the message area on the posting form. Even with this you may find the following guide useful.

This was definitely the smoothest game I've ever run, but that is thanks to the people playing not just me.

The two trackers were a conscious decision for balance, but mainly to serve as a reminder for the popular, but nowadays oft ignored, mafia adage "don't try to outguess the mod".
Well, it gave me another day to jack off alone in the mafia QT, so I appreciated it.

Full set up:

Town

5 vanilla townies
1 1-shot cop
1 1-shot vig
1 1-shot jk
1 1-shot tracker
tracker

Mafia

1 role cop
1 1-shot watcher
1 goon

Notes:
I liked the idea of a lot of one shot abilities, because then more people would have something fun to do with their role. Due to this setup, however, my main concern was a day one where a number of players were pushed to -1 and when they claimed their ability the rest of the town would back off and push another person to claim. Basically I was worried there would be an almost massclaim by proxy day one. To attempt to lessen the chances of this happening I added an extra vanilla townie, and to ensure the setup didn't become too predictable I added a normal nightly-use power role on both sides, and even doubled up one of the roles (tracker) on the town side.

Although the mafia did lose by a bit of a landslide they were rather unlucky to have
both
of their power-roles out of action by day 2. I think normally this sort of set-up would be a closer run affair. My only regret is the 1-shot cop. I normally don't like cop roles as I think they are overpowered and I feel they don't reward skill. Here even in it's 1-shot state it was probably a little too powerful in this game.

MVP - there were so many good players on the town side to choose from, although I would like to give special props to mogri for the vig on ion, silavor and greymarble for picking the entire scumteam day 1, and scumhunter for generally hunting scum well!
...but I am going to give the mvp to Slaxx for sticking in their all the way to the bitter end and providing a decent contest in this fairly one-sided affair.
